trans-unit.source: Every request made against the Scheduler service returns a response header named**x-ms-request-id**.
trans-unit.target: Every request made against the Scheduler service returns a response header named**x-ms-request-id**.

trans-unit.source: This header contains an opaque value that uniquely identifies the request.
trans-unit.target: This header contains an opaque value that uniquely identifies the request.

trans-unit.source: If a request is consistently failing and you have verified that the request is properly formulated, you may use this value to report the error to Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: If a request is consistently failing and you have verified that the request is properly formulated, you may use this value to report the error to Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: In your report, include the value ofx-ms-request-id, the approximate time that the request was made, the identifier of the subscription, cloud service, job collection, and/or job, and the type of operation that the request attempted.
trans-unit.target: In your report, include the value ofx-ms-request-id, the approximate time that the request was made, the identifier of the subscription, cloud service, job collection, and/or job, and the type of operation that the request attempted.

trans-unit.source: In addition to standard HTTP status codes, the Azure Scheduler REST API returns extended error codes and error messages.
trans-unit.target: In addition to standard HTTP status codes, the Azure Scheduler REST API returns extended error codes and error messages.

trans-unit.source: The extended codes do not replace the standard HTTP status codes, but provide additional, actionable information that can be used in conjunction with the standard HTTP status codes.
trans-unit.target: The extended codes do not replace the standard HTTP status codes, but provide additional, actionable information that can be used in conjunction with the standard HTTP status codes.

trans-unit.source: For example, an HTTP 404 error can occur for numerous reasons, so having the additional information in the extended message can assist with problem resolution.
trans-unit.target: For example, an HTTP 404 error can occur for numerous reasons, so having the additional information in the extended message can assist with problem resolution.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the standard HTTP codes returned by the REST API, see [Service Management Status and Error Codes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee460801.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the standard HTTP codes returned by the REST API, see [Service Management Status and Error Codes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee460801.aspx).

trans-unit.source: REST API operations for the Service Management API return standard HTTP status codes, as defined in the[HTTP/1.1 Status Code Definitions](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html).
trans-unit.target: REST API operations for the Service Management API return standard HTTP status codes, as defined in the[HTTP/1.1 Status Code Definitions](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html).

trans-unit.source: The following table describes common errors that may be returned by the service.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes common errors that may be returned by the service.

trans-unit.source: The versioning header is not specified or was specified incorrectly.
trans-unit.target: The versioning header is not specified or was specified incorrectly.

trans-unit.source: The request body’s XML was invalid or not correctly specified.
trans-unit.target: The request body’s XML was invalid or not correctly specified.

trans-unit.source: A required query parameter was not specified for this request or was specified incorrectly.
trans-unit.target: A required query parameter was not specified for this request or was specified incorrectly.

trans-unit.source: The HTTP verb specified was not recognized by the server or isn’t valid for this resource.
trans-unit.target: The HTTP verb specified was not recognized by the server or isn’t valid for this resource.

trans-unit.source: The server failed to authenticate the request.
trans-unit.target: The server failed to authenticate the request.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the certificate is valid and is associated with this subscription.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the certificate is valid and is associated with this subscription.

trans-unit.source: The specified resource does not exist.
trans-unit.target: The specified resource does not exist.

trans-unit.source: The server encountered an internal error.
trans-unit.target: The server encountered an internal error.

trans-unit.source: The operation could not be completed within the permitted time.
trans-unit.target: The operation could not be completed within the permitted time.

trans-unit.source: The server (or an internal component) is currently unavailable to receive requests.
trans-unit.target: The server (or an internal component) is currently unavailable to receive requests.

trans-unit.source: The subscription is in a disabled state.
trans-unit.target: The subscription is in a disabled state.

trans-unit.source: A conflict occurred to prevent the operation from completing.
trans-unit.target: A conflict occurred to prevent the operation from completing.

trans-unit.source: The requested object is not available.
trans-unit.target: The requested object is not available.

trans-unit.source: A temporary URI for the new location of the object can be obtained from the Location field in the response.
trans-unit.target: A temporary URI for the new location of the object can be obtained from the Location field in the response.

trans-unit.source: The original request can be repeated on the new URI.
trans-unit.target: The original request can be repeated on the new URI.

trans-unit.source: API operations may also return additional error information that is defined by the management service.
trans-unit.target: API operations may also return additional error information that is defined by the management service.

trans-unit.source: This additional error information is returned in the response body.
trans-unit.target: This additional error information is returned in the response body.

trans-unit.source: The body of the error response follows the basic format shown below.
trans-unit.target: The body of the error response follows the basic format shown below.
